thread.title_full: SNEAK PREVIEW: 'Crimson Peak,' Goosebumps,' 'Steve Jobs,' 'Bridge of Spies'

author: Al Alexander For the Patriot Ledger
title: SNEAK PREVIEW: 'Crimson Peak,' Goosebumps,' 'Steve Jobs,' 'Bridge of Spies'
text: SNEAK PREVIEW: 'Crimson Peak,' Goosebumps,' 'Steve Jobs,' 'Bridge of Spies' Learn more about this week's new movies. Comment For the Patriot Ledger Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 1:25 pm Updated at 1:37 PM CRIMSON PEAK Guillermo del Toro returns to his stylish horror roots with a tale of a young writer (Mia Wasikowska) and her secretive husband (Tom Hiddleston) being denied wedded bliss inside their creepy mansion. The ubiquitous Jessica Chastain co-stars. Steve Jobs STEVE JOBS Can writer Aaron Sorkin do for Steve Jobs (Michael Fassbender) what he did for Mark Zuckerberg in “The Social Network”? Bet on it! Especially with Oscar-winner Danny Boyle directing, and a supporting cast that includes Kate Winslet and Seth Rogen. GOOSEBUMPS R.L. Stine’s smash young-adult novels come to manic life when a transplanted teen (Dylan Minnette) and his new friends accidentally release the monsters contained in the books of his next-door neighbor, R.L. Stine (Jack Black). BRIDGE OF SPIES They saved Pvt. Ryan, now Tom Hanks and Steven Spielberg are saving Francis Gary Powers, the real-life spy-plane pilot shot down over the USSR and held captive by the smirking commies. BEASTS OF NO NATION Idris Elba stars in the affecting story of a kid soldier (Abraham Attah) torn from his family and robbed of his childhood in war-torn West Africa. Cary Fukunaga directs.
